item.title: Using Avr Assembly With Interrupts
item.author: norman@dunbar-it.co.uk (Norman Dunbar)
item.description: While writing my third Arduino book, Arduino Assembly Language, I needed to determine if interrupts can be used when mixing C++ and Assembly using the Arduino IDE. It turns out that it can be done. The Arduino IDE uses avr-g++ to compile the C++ sources (the *.ino files) and avr-gcc with the -assembler-with-cpp option to run avr-gas on any Assembly Language sources.
